2021-07-30.name: National Balloon Classic
2021-07-30.summary: This giant hot-air balloon festival includes daily flights, rides for the public, music, night glows and closing fireworks.

2021-07-30.name: Coast Guard Festival
2021-07-30.summary: There's nightly entertainment on the waterfront, a downtown carnival, tours of Coast Guard cutters, a Grand Parade and fireworks.

2021-07-30.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-07-30.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-07-30.name: EAA AirVenture
2021-07-30.summary: This huge Experimental Aircraft Association festival includes air shows, fireworks, big-name concerts, children's activities, workshops, exhibits and rides in historic aircraft.

2021-07-30.name: Lumberjack World Championships
2021-07-30.summary: You can't see this kind of thing just anywhere: cut-throat log rolling, boom running, springboard chopping and             speed climbing.

2021-07-30.name: Lollapalooza
2021-07-30.summary: This big music festival features dozens of bands and, unlike other Grant Park festivals, is not free. Reserve rooms far in advance.

2021-07-30.name: Prairie Dog Blues Festival
2021-07-30.summary: This Mississippi River festival on historic St. Feriole Island features 12 bands on two stages, with onsite camping.

2021-07-30.name: Riverboat Days
2021-07-30.summary: This Mississippi River town celebrates with a pedal tractor pull, duck derby, firemen's water fight and parade.

2021-07-30.name: Festa Italia
2021-07-30.summary: The heritage festival at McKee Farms Park in this Madison suburb features such things as folk dancing, a puppet show, a pasta-eating contest and vintage baseball as well as bocce ball.

2021-07-30.name: Blueberry Festival
2021-07-30.summary: Eat blueberry pizza and drink blueberry beer while listening to live music and watching dancers and medieval armored combat. There are also pony rides and games for kids.

2021-07-30.name: Soul & Blues Festival
2021-07-30.summary: This music festival is held downtown.

2021-07-30.name: Festa Italiana
2021-07-30.summary: This festival at the Naper Settlement is a showcase for Italian culture, food, music and artisans and has two entertainment stages.

2021-07-31.name: National Balloon Classic
2021-07-31.summary: This giant hot-air balloon festival includes daily flights, rides for the public, music, night glows and closing fireworks.

2021-07-31.name: Coast Guard Festival

2021-07-02.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-07-02.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-07-02.name: Riverfest
2021-07-02.summary: This riverfront festival includes music, magicians, dance, a water-ski show and fireworks by the La Crosse Skyrockers. Headliners include Randy Houser, Troy Cartwright and Chris Kroeze.

2021-07-02.name: National Women's Music Festival
2021-07-02.summary: In addition to concerts, this musical and cultural festival at the Marriott Madison West features comedy, theater, film and writers' workshops.

2021-07-02.name: Catfish River Music Festival
2021-07-02.summary: More than 20 bands perform in Rotary Park during this free festival, which includes artisans, food, beer, wine and fireworks on the Fourth and on Sunday.

2021-07-02.name: Riverfront Rendezvous
2021-07-02.summary: There's a noon parade on the Fourth plus lumberjack and magic shows, bands and, on Saturday, kids' games, a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2021-07-02.name: Iowa City Jazz Festival
2021-07-02.summary: This downtown festival features a Culinary Row, Fun Zone for kids and  fireworks in addition to music.

2021-07-03.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-07-03.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-07-03.name: Riverfest
2021-07-03.summary: This riverfront festival includes music, magicians, dance, a water-ski show and fireworks by the La Crosse Skyrockers. Headliners include Randy Houser, Troy Cartwright and Chris Kroeze.

2021-07-03.name: National Women's Music Festival
2021-07-03.summary: In addition to concerts, this musical and cultural festival at the Marriott Madison West features comedy, theater, film and writers' workshops.

2021-07-03.name: Catfish River Music Festival
2021-07-03.summary: More than 20 bands perform in Rotary Park during this free festival, which includes artisans, food, beer, wine and fireworks on the Fourth and on Sunday.

2021-07-03.name: National Cherry Festival
2021-07-03.summary: This town on Lake Michigan attracts half a million people to events that  include air shows, an arts fair, music, races, the big Cherry Royale Parade and many contests,  including pie-eating and pit-spitting.

2021-07-03.name: Riverfront Rendezvous
2021-07-03.summary: There's a noon parade on the Fourth plus lumberjack and magic shows, bands and, on Saturday, kids' games, a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2021-07-03.name: Iowa City Jazz Festival
2021-07-03.summary: This downtown festival features a Culinary Row, Fun Zone for kids and  fireworks in addition to music.

2021-07-07.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-07-07.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-07-07.name: National Cherry Festival
2021-07-07.summary: This town on Lake Michigan attracts half a million people to events that  include air shows, an arts fair, music, races, the big Cherry Royale Parade and many contests,  including pie-eating and pit-spitting.

2021-07-07.name: Karl Oskar Days
2021-07-07.summary: The festival in this Swedish town just north of the Twin Cities features fireworks, a car show and a parade.

2021-07-09.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-07-09.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-07-09.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2021-07-09.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 85th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2021-07-09.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder pageant
2021-07-09.summary: The festival in this western Minnesota town revolves around the book "On the             Banks of Plum Creek.''

2021-07-09.name: National Cherry Festival
2021-07-09.summary: This town on Lake Michigan attracts half a million people to events that  include air shows, an arts fair, music, races, the big Cherry Royale Parade and many contests,  including pie-eating and pit-spitting.

2021-07-09.name: Karl Oskar Days
2021-07-09.summary: The festival in this Swedish town just north of the Twin Cities features fireworks, a car show and a parade.

2021-07-09.name: Heart of the North Rodeo
2021-07-09.summary: Look for the four R's in this western Wisconsin town: roping, bull riding, steer             wrestling and barrel racing. A parade is on Saturday.

2021-07-09.name: Iola Old Car Show
2021-07-09.summary: This show and swap meet brings up to 130,000 people to this village east of Stevens Point.

2021-07-09.name: Hodag Country Festival
2021-07-09.summary: This year, performers at this big fest include Neal McCoy, Travis Tritt and Darius Rucker. There's a band contest, too.

2021-07-09.name: Riverfest
2021-07-09.summary: This Mississippi River town, known for its trumpeter swans in winter, celebrates summer with a car show, pie-eating contest, Friday fireworks and noon parade on Sunday.

2021-07-09.name: Wild Rice Festival
2021-07-09.summary: This northern town near Grand Rapids offers a powwow Friday, wild-rice lunch, bike rodeo, sawdust scramble, singing competition and fireworks Saturday and a parade Sunday.

2021-07-09.name: Bigfoot Days
2021-07-09.summary: This town in Chippewa National Forest, between Walker and Grand Rapids, calls itself the Home of Bigfoot. There will be a Bigfoot Olympics, a Bigfoot-calling contest, Bigfoot storytelling, a scavenger hunt and a petting zoo.

2021-07-09.name: Taste and Glow Balloon Fest
2021-07-09.summary: This first-year festival will feature hot-air balloons and also music, kids' activities, a tractor pull and a flea market.

2021-07-10.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-07-10.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-07-10.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2021-07-10.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 85th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2021-07-10.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder pageant
2021-07-10.summary: The festival in this western Minnesota town revolves around the book "On the             Banks of Plum Creek.''

2021-07-10.name: Fiesta Days
2021-07-10.summary: There's a Music Fest, carnival and car and motorcycle show in Petersen Park the first weekend. The second weekend, there's an art and street fair Saturday and a Sunday walk-by parade on Main Street.

2021-07-10.name: National Cherry Festival
2021-07-10.summary: This town on Lake Michigan attracts half a million people to events that  include air shows, an arts fair, music, races, the big Cherry Royale Parade and many contests,  including pie-eating and pit-spitting.

2021-07-10.name: Riverfest
2021-07-10.summary: This Mississippi River town, known for its trumpeter swans in winter, celebrates summer with a car show, pie-eating contest, Friday fireworks and noon parade on Sunday.

2021-07-10.name: Wild Rice Festival
2021-07-10.summary: This northern town near Grand Rapids offers a powwow Friday, wild-rice lunch, bike rodeo, sawdust scramble, singing competition and fireworks Saturday and a parade Sunday.

2021-07-10.name: Bigfoot Days
2021-07-10.summary: This town in Chippewa National Forest, between Walker and Grand Rapids, calls itself the Home of Bigfoot. There will be a Bigfoot Olympics, a Bigfoot-calling contest, Bigfoot storytelling, a scavenger hunt and a petting zoo.

2021-07-10.name: Taste and Glow Balloon Fest
2021-07-10.summary: This first-year festival will feature hot-air balloons and also music, kids' activities, a tractor pull and a flea market.

2021-07-10.name: Phelps Mill Festival
2021-07-10.summary: There's a juried arts and crafts fair, children's activities and music in this bucolic, tucked-away park along the Otter Tail River, next to an 1889 brick and clapboard mill that's open for tours.

2021-07-10.name: Grand Marais Arts Festival
2021-07-10.summary: This juried art show along the Lake Superior harbor includes children's activities, art demonstrations, a pie social and live music.

2021-07-10.name: Big Top Parade & Circus Celebration
2021-07-10.summary: In the downtown square, there will be circus-themed performances, walking tours, music, children's activities and a Big Top parade.

2021-07-14.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-07-14.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-07-14.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2021-07-14.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 85th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2021-07-14.name: Water Days
2021-07-14.summary: In this lakes town near Sibley State Park, there's a water-ski show, parade, kids' fishing derby and fireworks.

2021-07-14.name: Sinclair Lewis Days
2021-07-14.summary: The hometown of the Nobel Prize-winning author celebrates with turtle races, bicycle stunts, Friday fireworks, a craft fair, music and a parade Saturday.

2021-07-16.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-07-16.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-07-16.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2021-07-16.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 85th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2021-07-16.name: Water Days
2021-07-16.summary: In this lakes town near Sibley State Park, there's a water-ski show, parade, kids' fishing derby and fireworks.

2021-07-16.name: Sinclair Lewis Days
2021-07-16.summary: The hometown of the Nobel Prize-winning author celebrates with turtle races, bicycle stunts, Friday fireworks, a craft fair, music and a parade Saturday.

2021-07-16.name: Bavarian Blast
2021-07-16.summary: In addition to German music, food and beer, this festival at the Brown County Fair Grounds features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and sauerkraut-eating contests, plus a Sunday parade.

2021-07-16.name: Rock Fest
2021-07-16.summary: This year's outdoor festival near Chippewa Falls features Limp Bizkit, Korn and Disturbed.

2021-07-16.name: Country Jam
2021-07-16.summary: Morgan Wallen, Chris Young and Jon Pardi are  among the headliners of this fest. There's camping on-site.

2021-07-16.name: Paperfest
2021-07-16.summary: This Fox Cities town celebrates its heritage with toilet-paper tosses, lawn games, concerts, human foosball and a firefighter tug of war.

2021-07-16.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder pageant
2021-07-16.summary: The festival in this western Minnesota town revolves around the book "On the             Banks of Plum Creek.''

2021-07-16.name: Hiawatha Traditional Music Festival
2021-07-16.summary: This folk-music festival in Tourist Park also features a juried arts and crafts show and camping on-site.

2021-07-16.name: Lowertown Blues & Funk Festival
2021-07-16.summary: This free, all-ages festival is in Mears Park.

2021-07-16.name: Honor the Earth Pow-wow
2021-07-16.summary: The  Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa hold one of the largest powwows in North America, with dancing, singing and crafts plus a cooking contest, run/walk and softball tournament.

2021-07-16.name: Wannigan Days
2021-07-16.summary: St. Croix Falls and its cross-river neighbor, Taylors Falls, pay tribute to lumberjacks and river pigs with rock and country music, an arts and crafts fair, a Saturday parade and fireworks.

2021-07-16.name: Rivertown Days
2021-07-16.summary: In this river town south of St. Paul, there will be 25 bands on four stages, plus a carnival, arts & crafts fair and classic-car show.

2021-07-17.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-07-17.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-07-17.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2021-07-17.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 85th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2021-07-17.summary: This year's outdoor festival near Chippewa Falls features Limp Bizkit, Korn and Disturbed.

2021-07-17.summary: Morgan Wallen, Chris Young and Jon Pardi are  among the headliners of this fest. There's camping on-site.

2021-07-17.summary: This Fox Cities town celebrates its heritage with toilet-paper tosses, lawn games, concerts, human foosball and a firefighter tug of war.

2021-07-17.summary: The festival in this western Minnesota town revolves around the book "On the             Banks of Plum Creek.''

2021-07-17.name: Hiawatha Traditional Music Festival
2021-07-17.summary: This folk-music festival in Tourist Park also features a juried arts and crafts show and camping on-site.

2021-07-17.name: Lowertown Blues & Funk Festival
2021-07-17.summary: This free, all-ages festival is in Mears Park.

2021-07-17.name: Honor the Earth Pow-wow
2021-07-17.summary: The  Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa hold one of the largest powwows in North America, with dancing, singing and crafts plus a cooking contest, run/walk and softball tournament.

2021-07-17.name: Wannigan Days
2021-07-17.summary: St. Croix Falls and its cross-river neighbor, Taylors Falls, pay tribute to lumberjacks and river pigs with rock and country music, an arts and crafts fair, a Saturday parade and fireworks.

2021-07-17.name: Rivertown Days
2021-07-17.summary: In this river town south of St. Paul, there will be 25 bands on four stages, plus a carnival, arts & crafts fair and classic-car show.

2021-07-17.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2021-07-17.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2021-07-17.name: Stockholm Art Fair
2021-07-17.summary: This hamlet on Lake Pepin, a favorite day trip destination for Twin Citians, becomes a shopping mecca during this big fair.

2021-07-17.name: Agate Days
2021-07-17.summary: See the beautiful stones on display, then dig for them at 3 p.m. Saturday during the Agate Stampede, when a load             of rocks seeded with 400 pounds agates, $400 in quarters and $100 in 50-cent pieces is dumped downtown.

2021-07-17.name: Bayfront Reggae & World Music Festival
2021-07-17.summary: Listen to island music on the shore of Lake Superior.

2021-07-17.name: Mississippi Valley Blues Festival
2021-07-17.summary: In LeClaire Park on the river, blues musicians celebrate the music that traveled up the Mississippi.

2021-07-17.name: Fiesta Days
2021-07-17.summary: There's a Music Fest, carnival and car and motorcycle show in Petersen Park the first weekend. The second weekend, there's an art and street fair Saturday and a Sunday walk-by parade on Main Street.

2021-07-17.name: Minnesota Scottish Fair & Highland Games
2021-07-17.summary: This fest south of St. Paul features Celtic music, a British car show, a harp competition and heavy games, such as hammer throwing, sheaf tossing, caber turning and the stone put.

2021-07-17.name: Chinatown Summer Fair
2021-07-17.summary: There's a Lion Dance, Chinese  classical dance and music, demonstrations of martial arts and displays  of ancient art forms and disciplines plus a  petting zoo and pony rides.

2021-07-17.name: Civil War Encampment and Battle
2021-07-17.summary: This event at Old Falls Village features Lincoln's Gettysburg Address, storytelling and a soldier encampment with medical and cooking demonstration. General Grant narrates the Battle of Cedar Run, 2 p.m. both days.

2021-07-21.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-07-21.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-07-21.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2021-07-21.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2021-07-21.name: Aquatennial
2021-07-21.summary: The City of Lakes holds a Wednesday Torchlight Parade, water-ski shows and Saturday fireworks.

2021-07-23.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-07-23.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-07-23.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder pageant
2021-07-23.summary: The festival in this western Minnesota town revolves around the book "On the             Banks of Plum Creek.''

2021-07-23.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2021-07-23.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2021-07-23.name: Aquatennial
2021-07-23.summary: The City of Lakes holds a Wednesday Torchlight Parade, water-ski shows and Saturday fireworks.

2021-07-23.name: Nordic Fest
2021-07-23.summary: This friendly, authentic and very large festival of Scandinavian culture features a Viking encampment, kids' games, artisan demonstrations, lutefisk-eating and Nordic rock-throwing contests and a big parade at 10:30 a.m. Saturday

2021-07-23.name: Sweet Corn Days
2021-07-23.summary: In addition to free sweet corn, there will be Friday fireworks, a doughnut-hole eating contest, a kiddie tractor pull, carnival rides and a parade Saturday.

2021-07-23.name: Great Folle Avoine Fur Trade Rendezvous
2021-07-23.summary: At this rendezvous at a rebuilt post on the banks of the Yellow River, visit with costumed traders and voyageurs from the fur-trade era and see demonstrations of tomahawk-throwing, black-powder shooting, candlemaking and other skills. There will also be a candy cannon, bead pile and ladies' and kids' games.

2021-07-23.name: Waterama
2021-07-23.summary: This festival on the shores of Lake Minnewaska is famous for its lighted pontoon parade on Saturday, followed by fireworks. On Sunday, there's a parade on land, followed by a water-ski show.

2021-07-23.name: Pierogi Fest
2021-07-23.summary: This suburb of Chicago exalts the plump Eastern European dumplings, filled with cheese, mashed potatoes or             sauerkraut, with pierogi-eating and -tossing contests, a Mr. Pierogi songfest and a Polka Parade.

2021-07-23.name: La Crosse Storytelling Festival
2021-07-23.summary: Listen to local, regional and national storytellers spin tales at the Pump House. There will also be music and arts and crafts.

2021-07-23.name: Muskie Days
2021-07-23.summary: The festival in this lake town on the Heartland State Trail features an inflatable obstacle course, hula-hoop instruction, a casting contest, music on three stages, kids' games, an ice cream-eating contest and a parade  Saturday.

2021-07-24.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-07-24.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-07-24.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder pageant
2021-07-24.summary: The festival in this western Minnesota town revolves around the book "On the             Banks of Plum Creek.''

2021-07-24.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2021-07-24.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2021-07-24.name: Aquatennial
2021-07-24.summary: The City of Lakes holds a Wednesday Torchlight Parade, water-ski shows and Saturday fireworks.

2021-07-24.summary: This friendly, authentic and very large festival of Scandinavian culture features a Viking encampment, kids' games, artisan demonstrations, lutefisk-eating and Nordic rock-throwing contests and a big parade at 10:30 a.m. Saturday

2021-07-24.name: Sweet Corn Days
2021-07-24.summary: In addition to free sweet corn, there will be Friday fireworks, a doughnut-hole eating contest, a kiddie tractor pull, carnival rides and a parade Saturday.

2021-07-24.name: Great Folle Avoine Fur Trade Rendezvous
2021-07-24.summary: At this rendezvous at a rebuilt post on the banks of the Yellow River, visit with costumed traders and voyageurs from the fur-trade era and see demonstrations of tomahawk-throwing, black-powder shooting, candlemaking and other skills. There will also be a candy cannon, bead pile and ladies' and kids' games.

2021-07-24.name: Waterama
2021-07-24.summary: This festival on the shores of Lake Minnewaska is famous for its lighted pontoon parade on Saturday, followed by fireworks. On Sunday, there's a parade on land, followed by a water-ski show.

2021-07-24.name: Pierogi Fest
2021-07-24.summary: This suburb of Chicago exalts the plump Eastern European dumplings, filled with cheese, mashed potatoes or             sauerkraut, with pierogi-eating and -tossing contests, a Mr. Pierogi songfest and a Polka Parade.

2021-07-24.name: La Crosse Storytelling Festival
2021-07-24.summary: Listen to local, regional and national storytellers spin tales at the Pump House. There will also be music and arts and crafts.

2021-07-24.name: Muskie Days
2021-07-24.summary: The festival in this lake town on the Heartland State Trail features an inflatable obstacle course, hula-hoop instruction, a casting contest, music on three stages, kids' games, an ice cream-eating contest and a parade  Saturday.

2021-07-24.name: ArtBike + ArtCar Parade
2021-07-24.summary: Decorated bikes, cars and one Couchmobile will circle Lake Harriet at 6 p.m. Everyone is welcome to bring a decorated conveyance and join the parade; meet at 5 p.m. at the Rose Garden.

2021-07-24.name: Native American Festival
2021-07-24.summary: This family-friendly festival at the Museum of Ojibwa Culture features drumming, dancing, singing, Ojibwa games, artisan workshops and Sunday mass in Ojibwa.

2021-07-24.name: Wenonga Days
2021-07-24.summary: The festival in this lake-resort town near Glendalough State Park features walking tours, human foosball, turtle races, Civil War reenactors, a water-ski show and a parade at 7 p.m. Saturday, followed by a street dance and fireworks.

2021-07-28.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-07-28.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-07-28.name: EAA AirVenture
2021-07-28.summary: This huge Experimental Aircraft Association festival includes air shows, fireworks, big-name concerts, children's activities, workshops, exhibits and rides in historic aircraft.

2021-07-11.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2021-07-11.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 85th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2021-07-11.name: Fiesta Days
2021-07-11.summary: There's a Music Fest, carnival and car and motorcycle show in Petersen Park the first weekend. The second weekend, there's an art and street fair Saturday and a Sunday walk-by parade on Main Street.

2021-07-11.name: Karl Oskar Days
2021-07-11.summary: The festival in this Swedish town just north of the Twin Cities features fireworks, a car show and a parade.

2021-07-11.name: Hodag Country Festival
2021-07-11.summary: This year, performers at this big fest include Neal McCoy, Travis Tritt and Darius Rucker. There's a band contest, too.

2021-07-11.name: Riverfest
2021-07-11.summary: This Mississippi River town, known for its trumpeter swans in winter, celebrates summer with a car show, pie-eating contest, Friday fireworks and noon parade on Sunday.

2021-07-11.name: Wild Rice Festival
2021-07-11.summary: This northern town near Grand Rapids offers a powwow Friday, wild-rice lunch, bike rodeo, sawdust scramble, singing competition and fireworks Saturday and a parade Sunday.

2021-07-11.name: Taste and Glow Balloon Fest
2021-07-11.summary: This first-year festival will feature hot-air balloons and also music, kids' activities, a tractor pull and a flea market.

2021-07-11.name: Phelps Mill Festival
2021-07-11.summary: There's a juried arts and crafts fair, children's activities and music in this bucolic, tucked-away park along the Otter Tail River, next to an 1889 brick and clapboard mill that's open for tours.

2021-07-11.name: Grand Marais Arts Festival
2021-07-11.summary: This juried art show along the Lake Superior harbor includes children's activities, art demonstrations, a pie social and live music.

2021-07-12.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2021-07-12.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 85th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2021-07-13.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2021-07-13.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 85th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2021-07-15.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2021-07-15.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 85th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2021-07-15.name: Water Days
2021-07-15.summary: In this lakes town near Sibley State Park, there's a water-ski show, parade, kids' fishing derby and fireworks.

2021-07-15.name: Sinclair Lewis Days
2021-07-15.summary: The hometown of the Nobel Prize-winning author celebrates with turtle races, bicycle stunts, Friday fireworks, a craft fair, music and a parade Saturday.

2021-07-15.name: Bavarian Blast
2021-07-15.summary: In addition to German music, food and beer, this festival at the Brown County Fair Grounds features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and sauerkraut-eating contests, plus a Sunday parade.

2021-07-15.name: Rock Fest
2021-07-15.summary: This year's outdoor festival near Chippewa Falls features Limp Bizkit, Korn and Disturbed.

2021-07-15.name: Country Jam
2021-07-15.summary: Morgan Wallen, Chris Young and Jon Pardi are  among the headliners of this fest. There's camping on-site.

2021-07-15.name: Paperfest
2021-07-15.summary: This Fox Cities town celebrates its heritage with toilet-paper tosses, lawn games, concerts, human foosball and a firefighter tug of war.

2021-07-18.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2021-07-18.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 85th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2021-07-18.name: Water Days
2021-07-18.summary: In this lakes town near Sibley State Park, there's a water-ski show, parade, kids' fishing derby and fireworks.

2021-07-18.name: Sinclair Lewis Days
2021-07-18.summary: The hometown of the Nobel Prize-winning author celebrates with turtle races, bicycle stunts, Friday fireworks, a craft fair, music and a parade Saturday.

2021-07-18.name: Bavarian Blast
2021-07-18.summary: In addition to German music, food and beer, this festival at the Brown County Fair Grounds features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and sauerkraut-eating contests, plus a Sunday parade.

2021-07-18.name: Paperfest
2021-07-18.summary: This Fox Cities town celebrates its heritage with toilet-paper tosses, lawn games, concerts, human foosball and a firefighter tug of war.

2021-07-18.name: Hiawatha Traditional Music Festival
2021-07-18.summary: This folk-music festival in Tourist Park also features a juried arts and crafts show and camping on-site.

2021-07-18.name: Honor the Earth Pow-wow
2021-07-18.summary: The  Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa hold one of the largest powwows in North America, with dancing, singing and crafts plus a cooking contest, run/walk and softball tournament.

2021-07-18.name: Wannigan Days
2021-07-18.summary: St. Croix Falls and its cross-river neighbor, Taylors Falls, pay tribute to lumberjacks and river pigs with rock and country music, an arts and crafts fair, a Saturday parade and fireworks.

2021-07-18.name: Rivertown Days
2021-07-18.summary: In this river town south of St. Paul, there will be 25 bands on four stages, plus a carnival, arts & crafts fair and classic-car show.

2021-07-18.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2021-07-18.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2021-07-18.name: Agate Days
2021-07-18.summary: See the beautiful stones on display, then dig for them at 3 p.m. Saturday during the Agate Stampede, when a load             of rocks seeded with 400 pounds agates, $400 in quarters and $100 in 50-cent pieces is dumped downtown.

2021-07-18.name: Mississippi Valley Blues Festival
2021-07-18.summary: In LeClaire Park on the river, blues musicians celebrate the music that traveled up the Mississippi.

2021-07-18.name: Fiesta Days
2021-07-18.summary: There's a Music Fest, carnival and car and motorcycle show in Petersen Park the first weekend. The second weekend, there's an art and street fair Saturday and a Sunday walk-by parade on Main Street.

2021-07-18.name: Chinatown Summer Fair
2021-07-18.summary: There's a Lion Dance, Chinese  classical dance and music, demonstrations of martial arts and displays  of ancient art forms and disciplines plus a  petting zoo and pony rides.

2021-07-18.name: Civil War Encampment and Battle
2021-07-18.summary: This event at Old Falls Village features Lincoln's Gettysburg Address, storytelling and a soldier encampment with medical and cooking demonstration. General Grant narrates the Battle of Cedar Run, 2 p.m. both days.

2021-07-18.name: Woodstock Folk Festival
2021-07-18.summary: Listen to music on the square in this town just over the Wisconsin border from Lake             Geneva.

2021-07-19.name: Water Days
2021-07-19.summary: In this lakes town near Sibley State Park, there's a water-ski show, parade, kids' fishing derby and fireworks.

2021-07-19.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2021-07-19.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2021-07-20.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2021-07-20.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2021-07-22.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2021-07-22.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2021-07-22.name: Aquatennial
2021-07-22.summary: The City of Lakes holds a Wednesday Torchlight Parade, water-ski shows and Saturday fireworks.

2021-07-22.name: Nordic Fest
2021-07-22.summary: This friendly, authentic and very large festival of Scandinavian culture features a Viking encampment, kids' games, artisan demonstrations, lutefisk-eating and Nordic rock-throwing contests and a big parade at 10:30 a.m. Saturday

2021-07-22.name: Sweet Corn Days
2021-07-22.summary: In addition to free sweet corn, there will be Friday fireworks, a doughnut-hole eating contest, a kiddie tractor pull, carnival rides and a parade Saturday.

2021-07-22.name: Great Folle Avoine Fur Trade Rendezvous
2021-07-22.summary: At this rendezvous at a rebuilt post on the banks of the Yellow River, visit with costumed traders and voyageurs from the fur-trade era and see demonstrations of tomahawk-throwing, black-powder shooting, candlemaking and other skills. There will also be a candy cannon, bead pile and ladies' and kids' games.

2021-07-01.name: Riverfest
2021-07-01.summary: This riverfront festival includes music, magicians, dance, a water-ski show and fireworks by the La Crosse Skyrockers. Headliners include Randy Houser, Troy Cartwright and Chris Kroeze.

2021-07-01.name: National Women's Music Festival
2021-07-01.summary: In addition to concerts, this musical and cultural festival at the Marriott Madison West features comedy, theater, film and writers' workshops.

2021-07-01.name: Canada Day
2021-07-01.summary: On Canada Day at Fort William Historical Park, the continent's largest reconstructed fur post, admission is free to the first 500 visitors. There's also free corn on the cob, an inflatable obstacle course, axe-throwing, paintball, canoe rides, dance performances and bannock-making, log-sawing and lacrosse contests.

2021-07-01.name: Catfish River Music Festival
2021-07-01.summary: More than 20 bands perform in Rotary Park during this free festival, which includes artisans, food, beer, wine and fireworks on the Fourth and on Sunday.

2021-07-04.name: Riverfest
2021-07-04.summary: This riverfront festival includes music, magicians, dance, a water-ski show and fireworks by the La Crosse Skyrockers. Headliners include Randy Houser, Troy Cartwright and Chris Kroeze.

2021-07-04.name: National Women's Music Festival
2021-07-04.summary: In addition to concerts, this musical and cultural festival at the Marriott Madison West features comedy, theater, film and writers' workshops.

2021-07-04.name: Catfish River Music Festival
2021-07-04.summary: More than 20 bands perform in Rotary Park during this free festival, which includes artisans, food, beer, wine and fireworks on the Fourth and on Sunday.

2021-07-04.name: National Cherry Festival
2021-07-04.summary: This town on Lake Michigan attracts half a million people to events that  include air shows, an arts fair, music, races, the big Cherry Royale Parade and many contests,  including pie-eating and pit-spitting.

2021-07-04.name: Riverfront Rendezvous
2021-07-04.summary: There's a noon parade on the Fourth plus lumberjack and magic shows, bands and, on Saturday, kids' games, a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2021-07-04.name: Sub Fest
2021-07-04.summary: The fest at the Wisconsin Maritime Museum, home of the USS Cobia, is combined with Fourth on the Shore this year and features music, a parade and fireworks.

2021-07-04.name: Fire Over the Fox
2021-07-04.summary: Green Bay hosts the largest fireworks show north of Milwaukee, plus a water-ski show, carnival rides and music and family entertainment on five stages plus the Neville Public Museum. It's in Leicht Memorial Park.

2021-07-26.name: EAA AirVenture
2021-07-26.summary: This huge Experimental Aircraft Association festival includes air shows, fireworks, big-name concerts, children's activities, workshops, exhibits and rides in historic aircraft.

2021-07-27.name: EAA AirVenture
2021-07-27.summary: This huge Experimental Aircraft Association festival includes air shows, fireworks, big-name concerts, children's activities, workshops, exhibits and rides in historic aircraft.

2021-07-29.name: EAA AirVenture
2021-07-29.summary: This huge Experimental Aircraft Association festival includes air shows, fireworks, big-name concerts, children's activities, workshops, exhibits and rides in historic aircraft.

2021-07-29.name: Lumberjack World Championships
2021-07-29.summary: You can't see this kind of thing just anywhere: cut-throat log rolling, boom running, springboard chopping and             speed climbing.

2021-07-29.name: Lollapalooza
2021-07-29.summary: This big music festival features dozens of bands and, unlike other Grant Park festivals, is not free. Reserve rooms far in advance.

2021-07-05.name: National Cherry Festival
2021-07-05.summary: This town on Lake Michigan attracts half a million people to events that  include air shows, an arts fair, music, races, the big Cherry Royale Parade and many contests,  including pie-eating and pit-spitting.

2021-07-06.name: National Cherry Festival
2021-07-06.summary: This town on Lake Michigan attracts half a million people to events that  include air shows, an arts fair, music, races, the big Cherry Royale Parade and many contests,  including pie-eating and pit-spitting.

2021-07-08.name: National Cherry Festival
2021-07-08.summary: This town on Lake Michigan attracts half a million people to events that  include air shows, an arts fair, music, races, the big Cherry Royale Parade and many contests,  including pie-eating and pit-spitting.

2021-07-08.name: Karl Oskar Days
2021-07-08.summary: The festival in this Swedish town just north of the Twin Cities features fireworks, a car show and a parade.

2021-07-08.name: Heart of the North Rodeo
2021-07-08.summary: Look for the four R's in this western Wisconsin town: roping, bull riding, steer             wrestling and barrel racing. A parade is on Saturday.

2021-07-08.name: Iola Old Car Show
2021-07-08.summary: This show and swap meet brings up to 130,000 people to this village east of Stevens Point.

2021-07-08.name: Hodag Country Festival
2021-07-08.summary: This year, performers at this big fest include Neal McCoy, Travis Tritt and Darius Rucker. There's a band contest, too.

2021-07-08.name: Riverfest
2021-07-08.summary: This Mississippi River town, known for its trumpeter swans in winter, celebrates summer with a car show, pie-eating contest, Friday fireworks and noon parade on Sunday.

2021-07-25.name: Sweet Corn Days
2021-07-25.summary: In addition to free sweet corn, there will be Friday fireworks, a doughnut-hole eating contest, a kiddie tractor pull, carnival rides and a parade Saturday.

2021-07-25.name: Great Folle Avoine Fur Trade Rendezvous
2021-07-25.summary: At this rendezvous at a rebuilt post on the banks of the Yellow River, visit with costumed traders and voyageurs from the fur-trade era and see demonstrations of tomahawk-throwing, black-powder shooting, candlemaking and other skills. There will also be a candy cannon, bead pile and ladies' and kids' games.

2021-07-25.name: Waterama
2021-07-25.summary: This festival on the shores of Lake Minnewaska is famous for its lighted pontoon parade on Saturday, followed by fireworks. On Sunday, there's a parade on land, followed by a water-ski show.

2021-07-25.name: Pierogi Fest
2021-07-25.summary: This suburb of Chicago exalts the plump Eastern European dumplings, filled with cheese, mashed potatoes or             sauerkraut, with pierogi-eating and -tossing contests, a Mr. Pierogi songfest and a Polka Parade.

2021-07-25.name: Wenonga Days
2021-07-25.summary: The festival in this lake-resort town near Glendalough State Park features walking tours, human foosball, turtle races, Civil War reenactors, a water-ski show and a parade at 7 p.m. Saturday, followed by a street dance and fireworks.
